name: Stuffed Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with seasoned meat and rice. Mediterranean cuisine classic.

instructions.instruction: Cut tops off peppers and save as lids. Remove seeds and membranes inside.
instructions.tip: Make sure there are no holes in pepper bottoms.

instructions.instruction: Blanch peppers in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain and place upside-down to dry.
Heat olive oil in large pan over medium heat. Sauté onion 5 minutes.
Add ground beef. Break apart with wooden spoon and cook 8-10 minutes until fully browned.
instructions.tip: Meat shouldn't clump - break into small pieces.

instructions.instruction: Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute.
Add half the crushed tomatoes. Add oregano, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Remove from heat. Stir in cooked rice, most of the parsley, and half the cheese.
Pour remaining crushed tomatoes into bottom of baking dish. Add water or broth.
Stand peppers upright in dish. Fill each with meat mixture.
instructions.tip: Don't pack too tight - filling expands.

instructions.instruction: Remove foil. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Bake 10-15 more minutes until cheese is melted and slightly golden.
Remove from oven. Rest 5 minutes. Garnish with remaining parsley and serve.

tips: Red, yellow, and orange peppers are sweeter than green.
Turkey or chicken ground meat is leaner option.
Quinoa instead of rice increases protein and fiber.
For vegetarian, use lentils or mushrooms instead of meat.
servingSuggestion: Serve with yogurt sauce or tzatziki. Crusty bread soaks up the sauce!
variations: Mexican style: Use black beans, corn, and taco seasoning.
Mediterranean: Add feta cheese and olives.
Vegetarian: Use lentils or tofu instead of meat.
Low-carb: Use cauliflower rice instead of regular rice.
